name: Limgo
description:
A fully interactive maze game made directly in Figma using interactive components.


Watch for the hints to discover all the features.


Have fun, and don't forget... have fun! 🤗


Features

Anti-cheat System

  • prevent player to use arrow keys to navigate between screens
  • create a safe area and prevent player to leave it
  • a very basic collision detection system

Animation Techniques

  • animate by changing layer names
  • animate by using auto-layout
  • animate by using variants
  • animate by using masks
  • timer animation
  • timed cinematics between levels
  • skip cinematic using Spacebar key

Other Techniques

  • debug using variants
  • asset optimization for prototype
  • asset generation using auto-layout


Notes

If you want to play a second time, you have to reload the page. 😔

For the moment, the game works as expected only on the first run.

I recommend not use the R key in the middle of the game, as you'll encounter broken cinematics.


There are currently 3 known ways to cheat, try to not cheat. 😁

But it will be cool to see the fourth method. 🤭


Expected to be played at 100% zoom, but if you encounter any issues feel free to change it to Fill or Fit. 😎


Some insights

The core was discovered while was working on Snake Game.


Then it took me around 1 month and a half to define the story, style, animations and to polish the gameplay at a decent level. (average at max 4 hours per day)


This was more like an experiment to see how far interactive components can go. 🔝


See credits at the end of the game for even more insights. ✌️
